intro: Conomorpha occigranatensis, commonly known as the granular conomorpha, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, granular texture on its leaves and stems. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are fleshy and contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
